description.other_details: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/.

term_definitions.items: Additional contextual detail to be applied to all compositions.
Details of personal name of an individual, provider or third party.
Name in free text unstructured format.
Name previously used by this person.
Name given to this person at birth.
Other name used by this person.
Name used by this persion before marriage.
The date interval at which this name was valid.
The prefix or title used by the subject.
Additional term used following a person name.
The name used by the subject for business or professional purposes.
The name by which the subject is officially registered.
The subject’s name as it is to be used for reporting, when used with a specific identifier.
Indicates that this is the name by which a person chooses to be identified.
Professional demographics details including name(s) , addresse(s) and telecommunication contact details.
The employment grade or position of the carer.
Team to which the individual belongs.
The period during which this professional was involved in care of the subject.
Personal name details of the individual.
Professional role details of the individual.
Organisation details to which the individual is attached.
Details about a contact person within organisation.
Findings observed during the inspection of the cervix.
Statement that no abnormality was detected (NAD) on physical examination.
Record as True if no abnormality was detected on examination. Specific statements about the examination can be included in the 'Clinical Interpretation' data element.
Narrative description of the overall findings observed during the physical examination.
Structured details about the physical examination findings.
Digital image, video or diagram representing the physical examination findings.
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.
Additional narrative about the physical examination findings, not captured in other fields.
Details to explicitly record that this examination was not performed.
The cervical discharge is clear in appearance.
The cervical discharge is mucopurulent in appearance.
The cervical discharge is brick-coloured in appearance.
The cervical discharge is fresh blood.
The presence or absence of cervical ectopia.
Narrative description about the cervical ectropion.
Structured elements relating to other specific findings.
The presence or absence of the specified finding.
Narrative description about the specific finding.
The number of the specified finding observed.
The site where the specified finding is observed.
A structured anatomical location of the finding.
A cervical discharge was not present.
It was not possible to determine if a cervical discharge was present or absent.
Narrative description about the cervical discharge.
It was not possible to determine if an ectropion was present or absent.
It was not possible to determine if the lesions were present or absent.
Findings observed during the physical examination of an identified lesion.
Identification of the body site under examination.

The body site could be on an area of skin or a mucous membrane, for example the right knee, palate or duodenum. If the body site has previously been identified in another archetype in which this archetype is nested, this data element becomes redundant.
Identification of the type of lesion found on physical examination.
'Lesion type' should be coded with a terminology, where possible. For example, mole, papilloma or depigmented area.
Narrative description of the overall findings observed during the physical examination.
Structured details about the physical examination findings.
Digital image, video or diagram representing the physical examination findings.
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.
Additional narrative about the physical examination findings, not captured in other fields.
Details to explicitly record that this examination was not performed.
A structured anatomical location of the lesion.
If the body site has previously been identified in another archetype in which this archetype is then nested, this SLOT becomes redundant.
Identification, by using a alias name, of the lesion to distinguish one lesion from similar lesions at the same body site.
For example, 'Mole #1' as marked on a diagram of the body site.
Image which enables a structured organ location entry.
Details about an multimedia representation of the clinical data.
Multimedia representation of the clinical observation or finding.
Title or identification of the multimedia resource.
The source of the multimedia resource.
Date/time that the multimedia resource was created.
Narrative description of the multimedia resource.
Date/time that the multimedia resource was published.
The version of the multimedia resource.
Internet link to the multimedia resource.
Name of the creator of the resource.
A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.
Identification of the procedure by name.
Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use to capture detailed, structured information about anatomical location, method & technique, equipment used, devices implanted, results, findings etc.
The procedure to be undertaken is planned.
Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.
Details about any complication arising from the procedure.

Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated complications. If the requirements for recording complication are more complex then use of a specific CLUSTER archetype within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype is advised and this data element becomes redundant. Examples: Hematuria after a kidney biopsy, tissue irritation after insertion of intravenous catheter.
Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified procedure was carried out.
For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure.

This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure planned' (at0004) pathway step which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.
(Was: The procedure to be undertaken is planned.)

This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure request sent' (at0007) pathway step which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.
The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.
The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Narrative description about the procedure, as appropriate for the pathway step.
For example: description about the performance and findings from the the procedure, the aborted attempt or the cancellation of the procedure.
The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
This is equivalent to Placer Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.
This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
The date and/or time when the entire procedure, or the last component of a multicomponent procedure, was finished.

Only for use in association with the 'Procedure performed' pathway step, and in situations where the procedure is repeated on multiple occasions before being completed or there are multiple components to the whole procedure. This may be the same as the RM time attribute for the 'Procedure completed' pathway step.
The total amount of time taken to complete the procedure, which may include time spent during the active phase of the procedure plus time during which the procedure was suspended.
Only for use in association with the 'Procedure completed' pathway steps.
Mulitimedia representation of a performed procedure.
Identification of the body site for the procedure.

Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as removing multiple skin lesions in different places, but where all of the other attributes are identical. Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the anatomical location is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
Identification of specific method or technique for the procedure.

Use this data element to record simple terms or a narrative description. If the requirements for recording the method require more complex modelling then this can be represented by additional archetypes within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the method is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.
The date and/or time on which the procedure is intended to be performed.
Only for use in association with the 'Procedure scheduled' pathway step.
This pragmatic data element may be used to support organisation within the user interface.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.
Difficulties or issues encountered during performance of the procedure.
Examples: The patient was agitated, insufficient emptying of the stomach before gastroscopy, a tumour in the bile ducts made it impossible to pass the scope through.
Findings observed during the physical examination of the vulva.
Statement that no abnormality was detected (NAD) on physical examination.
Record as True if no abnormality was detected on examination. Specific statements about the examination can be included in the 'Clinical Interpretation' data element.
Narrative description of the overall findings observed during the physical examination.
Structured details about the physical examination findings.
Digital image, video or diagram representing the physical examination findings.
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.
Additional narrative about the physical examination findings, not captured in other fields.
Details to explicitly record that this examination was not performed.
A detailed examination of a specific part of the vulva.
A structured anatomical location of the site examined.
Image which enables a structured organ location entry.
Details about an multimedia representation of the clinical data.
Multimedia representation of the clinical observation or finding.
Title or identification of the multimedia resource.
The source of the multimedia resource.
Date/time that the multimedia resource was created.
Narrative description of the multimedia resource.
Date/time that the multimedia resource was published.
The version of the multimedia resource.
Internet link to the multimedia resource.
Name of the creator of the resource.

This is equivalent to Placer Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.
This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
The date and/or time when the entire procedure, or the last component of a multicomponent procedure, was finished.

Only for use in association with the 'Procedure performed' pathway step, and in situations where the procedure is repeated on multiple occasions before being completed or there are multiple components to the whole procedure. This may be the same as the RM time attribute for the 'Procedure completed' pathway step.
The total amount of time taken to complete the procedure, which may include time spent during the active phase of the procedure plus time during which the procedure was suspended.
Only for use in association with the 'Procedure completed' pathway steps.
Mulitimedia representation of a performed procedure.
Identification of the body site for the procedure.

If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the anatomical location is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.

Difficulties or issues encountered during performance of the procedure.
Examples: The patient was agitated, insufficient emptying of the stomach before gastroscopy, a tumour in the bile ducts made it impossible to pass the scope through.
Findings observed during the inspection of the vagina.
Statement that no abnormality was detected (NAD) on physical examination.
Record as True if no abnormality was detected on examination. Specific statements about the examination can be included in the 'Clinical Interpretation' data element.
Narrative description of the overall findings observed during the physical examination.
Structured details about the physical examination findings.
Digital image, video or diagram representing the physical examination findings.
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.
Additional narrative about the physical examination findings, not captured in other fields.
For example, noting recent removal of tampon.
Details to explicitly record that this examination was not performed.
Evidence of menstruation is observed at time of inspection.
Record as True if no abnormality was detected on examination. Specific statements about the examination can be included in the 'Clinical Interpretation' data element.
Image which enables a structured organ location entry.

Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as removing multiple skin lesions in different places, but where all of the other attributes are identical. Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the requirements for recording the method require more complex modelling then this can be represented by additional archetypes within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the method is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.

This pragmatic data element may be used to support organisation within the user interface.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.
Difficulties or issues encountered during performance of the procedure.
Examples: The patient was agitated, insufficient emptying of the stomach before gastroscopy, a tumour in the bile ducts made it impossible to pass the scope through.
Document to communicate information to others, commonly in response to a request from another party.
The status of the entire report. Note: This is not the status of any of the report components.
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.

items.items: *Document to communicate information to others, commonly in response to a request from another party.(en)
*The status of the entire report. Note: This is not the status of any of the report components.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)
* e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.(en)
*Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

*Structured information about the procedure. Use to capture detailed, structured information about anatomical location, method & technique, equipment used, devices implanted, results, findings etc.(en)
*Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.(en)
*Details about any complication arising from the procedure.(en)

*Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated complications. If the requirements for recording complication are more complex then use of a specific CLUSTER archetype within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype is advised and this data element becomes redundant. (en)
*Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified procedure was carried out.(en)
*For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure.(en)
*The procedure to be undertaken is planned.(en)
*The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.(en)
*The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.(en)
*The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.(en)
*Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Narrative description about the procedure, as appropriate for the pathway step.(en)
*For example: description about the performance and findings from the the procedure, the aborted attempt or the cancellation of the procedure.(en)
*The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.(en)
*This is equivalent to Placer Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.(en)
Kdo je naročil aktivnost, posameznik ali organizacija
*The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.(en)
*This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.(en)
*Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*The date and/or time when the entire procedure, or the last component of a multicomponent procedure, was finished.(en)

*Only for use in association with the 'Procedure performed' pathway step, and in situations where the procedure is repeated on multiple occasions before being completed or there are multiple components to the whole procedure. This may be the same as the RM time attribute for the 'Procedure completed' pathway step.(en)
*The total amount of time taken to complete the procedure, which may include time spent during the active phase of the procedure plus time during which the procedure was suspended.(en)
*Only for use in association with the 'Procedure completed' pathway steps.(en)
*Identification of the body site for the procedure.(en)

*Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as removing multiple skin lesions in different places, but where all of the other attributes are identical. Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the anatomical location is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*Identification of specific method or technique for the procedure.(en)

*Use this data element to record simple terms or a narrative description. If the requirements for recording the method require more complex modelling then this can be represented by additional archetypes within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the method is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.(en)

Slika, ki omogoča strukturiran vnos lokacij na organu.
*Findings observed during the physical examination of an identified lesion. (en)
*Identification of the body site under examination. (en)

*The body site could be on an area of skin or a mucous membrane, for example the right knee, palate or duodenum. If the body site has previously been identified in another archetype in which this archetype is nested, this data element becomes redundant. (en)

*For example, 'Mole #1' as marked on a diagram of the body site. (en)

Izjava, da ni bilo opažene nobene abnormalnosti med fizičnim pregledom.
*Record as True if no abnormality was detected on examination. Specific statements about the examination can be included in the 'Clinical Interpretation' data element. (en)
Besedni opis splošnih izsledkov ugotovljenih med fizičnim pregledom.
Strukturirane podrobnosti o izsledkih fizičnega pregleda.
Digitalna slika, video ali diagram, ki predstavlja izsledke fizičnega pregleda.
Ena beseda, fraza ali kratek opis, ki predstavlja klinični pomen ali pomembnost izsledkov fizičnega pregleda.
Dodaten opisni komentar o izsledkih fizičnega pregleda, ki jih ni mogoče zajeti v drugih poljih.
*For example, noting recent removal of tampon. (en)
Natančen zapis, da ta specifičen pregled ni bil opravljen.
Zapis, da so med pregledom bili opaženi jasni znaki menstruacije.
*Record as True if no abnormality was detected on examination. Specific statements about the examination can be included in the 'Clinical Interpretation' data element. (en)
